page.title: 08SEAVIEW DUVER BIRDLIFE
page.content: Seaview Dover is an area of coastal } wetland with a small lake, reedbed, bramble scrub and marshy pasture. Although not large enough to be a significant nature reserve it is a valuable pocket of land for wildlife especially birds. The area provides a breeding site for {Little Grebe, Shelduck, Mallard, {Lapwing, Reed and Sedge Warbler and {Reed Bunting.}During the summer {Kestrel, Sparrowhawk}and{Little Owl are present and a{Kingfisher}is occasionally seen. In winter there is an increase in wildfowl, up to 80{Brent Goose}fly from the shore often joining{Barnacle, {Canada}and{Snow Goose}that have come from Flamingo Park nearby.{Tufted Duck and{Pochard}feed on the lake. Birds such as{Whinchat, Wheatear}and {Black Redstart}visit on migration.
